Also, to note, in F90, when you declare and allocate dp as (0:k, 0: current_q), the first rows go from 0 to k, so j_max is current_q. Now, perhaps the code outline can be written as:

program atcoder_problem 

   implicit none 

   integer, parameter :: max_len_size = 60 

   integer(kind=8) :: modulo_val = 1000000007_8 

   integer :: n, k 

   integer :: current_q, l, r, j, i, pos 

   integer :: len(max_len_size) 

   integer(kind=8), allocatable :: dp(:,:) 

  

   read*, n, k 

  

   current_q =0 

   l = 1 

   do while (l <= n) 

      r = n/(n/l) 

      current_q = current_q +1 

      if (current_q >max_len_size) then 

         print *,"Error: max_len exceeded" 

         stop 

      endif 

      len(current_q) = r - l +1 

      l = r +1 

   end do 

  

   allocate( dp(0:k, 0:current_q), mold=0 )

   !

Thus, final steps in F90:

Implementing with the corrections for modulo and multiplication overflow. Final Code:

program atcoder_ABC132_F

   implicit none

   integer, parameter :: max_len_size = 60
   integer(kind=8), parameter :: modulo_val = 1000000007_8

   integer :: n, k
   integer :: current_q, l, r, i, j, pos
   integer :: len(max_len_size)
   integer(kind=8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)

   read*, n, k

   current_q = 0
   l = 1

   do while (l <= n)
      r = n / (n / l)
      current_q = current_q + 1
      if (current_q > max_len_size) then
         print *, "Error: Exceeded maximum length"
         stop
      end if
      len(current_q) = r - l + 1
      l = r + 1
   end do

   !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Allocate DP array with dimensions (0 to k, 0 to current_q)
   allocate(dp(0:k, 0:current_q)) dp = 0_8

   ! Initialize first row (i=0)
   do j = 1, current_q
      dp(0,j) = dp(0,j-1) + len(j)
   end do

   ! Fill DP for i from 1 to k-1
   do i = 1, k-1
      do j = 1, current_q
         pos = current_q - j + 1
         integer :: len_mod
         integer(kind=8) :: temp, temp_part

         len_mod = mod(len(j), modulo_val)
         temp_part = mod(dp(i-1, pos), modulo_val) * len_mod
         temp_part = mod(temp_part, modulo_val)
         temp = dp(i, j-1) + temp_part
         dp(i,j) = mod(temp, modulo_val)
      end do
   end do

   print *, dp(k-1, current_q)

   deallocate(dp)
end program atcoder_ABC132_F

Implementing with the corrections for modulo and multiplication overflow.

Final Code:

program atcoder_ABC132_F

   implicit none

   integer, parameter :: max_len_size = 60
   integer(kind=8), parameter :: modulo_val = 1000000007_8

   integer :: n, k
   integer :: current_q, l, r, i, j, pos
   integer :: len(max_len_size)
   integer(kind=8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)

   read*, n, k

   current_q = 0
   l = 1

   do while (l <= n)
      r = n / (n / l)
      current_q = current_q + 1
      if (current_q > max_len_size) then
         print *, "Error: Exceeded maximum length"
         stop
      end if
      len(current_q) = r - l + 1
      l = r + 1
   end do

   ! Allocate DP array with dimensions (0 to k, 0 to current_q)
   allocate(dp(0:k, 0:current_q))
   dp = 0_8

   ! Initialize first row (i=0)
   do j = 1, current_q
      dp(0,j) = dp(0,j-1) + len(j)
   end do

   ! Fill DP for i from 1 to k-1
   do i = 1, k-1
      do j = 1, current_q
         pos = current_q - j + 1
         integer :: len_mod
         integer(kind=8) :: temp, temp_part

         len_mod = mod(len(j), modulo_val)
         temp_part = mod(dp(i-1, pos), modulo_val) * len_mod
         temp_part = mod(temp_part, modulo_val)
         temp = dp(i, j-1) + temp_part
         dp(i,j) = mod(temp, modulo_val)
      end do
   end do

   print *, dp(k-1, current_q)

   deallocate(dp)
end program atcoder_ABC132_F

This code should now function correctly, including preventing overflow using modular arithmetic steps.
